pullRequest.body:
This adds the graded tensor product $A \hat\otimes_R B$, imbued with a multiplication defined on homogeneous
tensors by:
$$(a \hat\otimes b) \cdot (a' \hat\otimes b') = (-1)^{\deg a' \deg b} (a \cdot a') \hat\otimes (b \cdot b')$$
where $A$ and $B$ are algebras graded by `ℕ`, `ℤ`, or `ZMod 2` (or more generally, any index that satisfies `Module ι (Additive ℤˣ)`).

We do this in two phases:

* Define bundled morphisms that perform the multiplication and braiding maps on regular tensor products of `DirectSum`s
* Define a new `GradedTensorProduct` type synonym that attaches the multiplication operator to `*` notation, and restricts itself to internally-graded algebras.

---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Naming suggestions would be appreciated, I can't find a particularly good reference.

This was a project I suggested at LftCM2023 that ultimately wasn't allocated; though I think I recall that @rzeidler expressed some interest in it.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/81ebcc37-14de-4a56-aa53-bae872673723) for commit 07d6f7bae075d66c280f08ecc63c284c7c027835.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/0577a905-101a-4ac6-8f61-76b9ea77d4e8/to/81ebcc37-14de-4a56-aa53-bae872673723) against commit b2d415234c85aceb6ffbb857ef4c309e2499a2c6:
```diff
  Benchmark                                        Metric         Change
  ======================================================================
- lint                                             wall-clock       7.1%
- ~Mathlib.Algebra.DirectSum.Algebra               instructions     7.0%
- ~Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.DirectSum.TensorProduct   instructions     6.5%
```
Darn, just misses the top 10 slowest files by one place

This looks great and basically optimal. I have no high level picture comments, because I don't know the mathematics incredibly well, and all that I know makes me expect exactly what you did.

I have a few scattered comments, but I'm overall happy.
This is peak Eric code. I can't find anything to point out but typos!

LGTM

maintainer merge

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ((a₁ : A) ⊗ₜ'[R] (b₁ : B) * (a₂ : A) ⊗ₜ'[R] (b₂ : B) : 𝒜 ⊗'[R] ℬ) = ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (a₁ ⊗ₜ'[R] (b₁ : B) * (a₂ : A) ⊗ₜ'[R] b₂ : 𝒜 ⊗'[R] ℬ) = ```
I've made [a zulip thread about this](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/116395-maths/topic/Powers.20of.20.60.E2.84.A4.CB.A3.60.20by.20.60ZMod.202.60/near/396291926).

Let me ask the classical question in those timeout-cursed parts of the library: Should this definition be made irreducible? Do you have benchmark results one way or the other? If not, can you gather them?

I've left this as a potential TODO in the module comment. Irreducibility would make a lot of things more painful here I think, and I'd rather not pay that cost until there is more than one downstream file using it.
Can you briefly explain in the module doc why you must use a type alias?
Done.
Can this be simp?

```suggestion
theorem gradedComm_of_tmul_of (i j : ι) (a : 𝒜 i) (b : ℬ j) :
```

```suggestion
* `TensorProduct.gradedMul`: the previously described multiplication on externally-graded rings, as
  a bilinear map.
```

Not sure this was intentional
```suggestion

```

Are the brackets necessary?
```suggestion
    letI AB := DirectSum _ 𝒜 ⊗[R] DirectSum _ ℬ
```

I assume this was for development only and that we shouldn't be committing `save` in final code?
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
and the tensor product of direct sums. -/
```
